page.title: 04Planning Problems
page.content: There is little land available for development.A general hospital is desperately needed and there are plans to build one on allotments, but there are financial problems.Available land has been used for service rather than manufacturing industries.Although small industrial units have been developed in a former secondary school.The old school canteen is being developed into a community centre but is hampered by vandalism.The most controversial schemes are the Benfield Valley and the Brighton by-pass. Housing in Hove is very expensive.The aveage 3 bedroomed semi-detached house costs around Â£45 000. Many seafront dwellings have been turned into flatlets.New housing and council houses are selling quickly.Lack of public housing is a problem.Money is spent on improving council houses.
